intro: Cheirinia strictissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in poor soils make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
